result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deontrae M Washington

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Deontrae M Washington in court with attorney James Gregory McCann.  William G. Davidson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  
Pursuant to negotiations, case is DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing in case#17CM417.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Deontrae M Washington in court with attorney James Gregory McCann by telephone.  Andrea Lynn Fendry appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Attorney McCann in court earlier.  Defendant checked-in late due to school obligations.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  All parties are notified effective July 29, 2017 this case will be assigned to Judge Thomas J. McAdams, Branch 7, in Room 515 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 23, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Deontrae M Washington in court with attorney James McCann.  William G. Davidson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requested time to review discovery.  Status conference scheduled for July 20, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Deontrae M Washington in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Ian Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
case scheduled for plea/sentencing hearing.  Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is granted by the court. Defense counsel will notify Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel for the defendant. Case adjourned for status of counsel in branch 10.  Status conference scheduled for June 20, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Justice Point Violation Report received and filed: missed office visit on 5-10-2017. 
Court takes no action and will address the matter on the next court date.

Defendant Deontrae M Washington in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  William G. Davidson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned to Branch 10.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 6, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Justice Point Violation Report received and filed: missed office visit on 3-22-2017. Defendant regained contact on 3-27-2017. Court takes no action and will address the matter on the next court date.

Defendant Deontrae M Washington in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  William Davidson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Statements by defense counsel regarding the case being set for jury trial by the prior Judge. Defense requests to vacate jury trial date and set case for status conference to follow 17CM417. Court grants request and vacates 5-05-2017 jury trial date. Case adjourned to Branch 10.  Status conference scheduled for May 5, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Received and Filed, Justice Point VIOLATION Report; Missed Office Contact.

Defendant Deontrae M Washington in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  William Davidson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense has not yet received discovery.  Defense requests a status conference date. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial to Branch 10.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 16, 2017 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for April 10, 2017 at 08:30 am.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services VIOLATION Report received and filed.  

Defendant has new charges.

Defendant Deontrae M Washington in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  William P Dockry appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court in trial, defense requests  Status date.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 4.  
Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Status conference scheduled for February 14, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services dated 1-10-2017 Report received and filed.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.   No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia and no alcohol. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Deontrae M Washington in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Defendant Deontrae M Washington in custody.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LNR  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 11, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($100.00 signature bond) gj
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 100.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Terese M. Dick appeared earlier in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for pretrial conference.  Defendant failing to appear. On State's motion, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, and no drug paraphernalia.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Deontrae M Washington in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Defendant Deontrae M Washington in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 45.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Deontrae M Washington not in court.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4-23-2015 at 1:30pm
